introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• Mary Seacole (1805–1881) was a British-Jamaican nurse.
• During the Crimean War, Seacole set up the British Hotel to provide shelter and medical care for soldiers.
• She also visited battlefields and treated the wounded.
• Despite facing discrimination, Seacole financed her own journey to the conflict.
• She later wrote a memoir detailing her experiences.
question: The student wants to emphasize Mary Seacole’s perseverance in providing care during wartime. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: Mary Seacole was a British-Jamaican nurse who wrote a memoir about her work.
B: Although Mary Seacole faced discrimination, she financed her own trip to the Crimean War and established the British Hotel to treat soldiers.
C: Mary Seacole provided medical care through the British Hotel, which offered shelter to wounded soldiers.
D: During the Crimean War, many nurses assisted on battlefields, but few documented their experiences so extensively.
explanation: Choice B highlights her perseverance in the face of discrimination and her initiative in traveling to the war zone and treating soldiers.
